TextBlock.TextLine: London George Cole-
In Antwerp 7 Janu 1681
Sin answer to yd of 24 past I observe m. Holroid draws on mee £200
so much sow him & consequently past so much to the creditt side of my
sterling accompt of mr Joseph Vivians, with the £50: you now order ee
to charge mr. Abram Vivians with all so what there shall be due to you
by the ea s ame acctt. shall be remitted you pr very first with what monyes
siam graspe toghether upon the other accts. I shall be contented with what you
conclude with mr. Holroid concerning overrating & provision of or tis
yd owne intrest: butt that I should allow him intrest & charges for non
paying his bill that I do not understand because itt unreasonable
to demand mony where he was in debted: for he knew that I did in compt
with Ju. deseased accompts are now made us, so want butt time to
draw y. out, which I hope to performe speedly as for p. of light wee sell
m
them here, or gett yr. coynett in pattacoones, I have had those that gained &
some that lost almost oft iuera p: for they are no more currant here,
they come directly from Spaine or the indies they will gaine tire opportuni
wel have from Ostend if secure by ships & when juse to send gold for Bruges
I do ordinary send itt with the messang & the £300: flemish or there about cost
acrowne to bring itt thether & the passage I Rekon secure: my freind beeng
mr. Raphael Coots att bruges of which m. maynard can give you more satisfactua
I haveing sent him of late 2 parcels of gold where in I can serve you
freely command him that wish you an happy new year & remamer
In Antwerp 7 January 1681
London Abram vivians
2j
th
Sr my last to you was on the 4 curitt with a bill for £150: on mr. Will Sampson
h
in London due 13. curitt for my acctt. this I hope shall become to yd handes
sence recd in good time yd of 24 past, because I am now a makeing up
of the laces, which will be ordered according to yds instructions & a fine
assortment sent p. next fridays post to new port with the acctt a saturday
hopeing they will come to yd handes in a good condition what passes about
our goods in the north please to advise I have then att least made you
debter for the £50 you recd. from mr. Cole & that mony which I pay so long
ago attributed in payment of Holvoides bill which I have now from him
& answered mr. Cole the need full yd linnen shall be bought with all
maginable care & expedition I hope the formar is well come to handes as
also the picture for a keen I could wish itt did prove to content in case you
can delay a while, shall endeavour to send you an other remise for yd acctt
& mine & so with very kinde saluts remaine
I could wish you would not take itt to remember the £80: bill to discours
I.Cole of as I desired when you here In Antwerpen 8 Januarj 1681
Hulft John button
Monsr. volgens ul. ordre heb aen ul gesonden den deser p bode blommaert
op Een gerost 2 witte kersijen vin
„1 a 22 geirde root leijst het best dat ick hadde a ƒƒ22-
„ 30 Geirden ditto
soo eenigh van diergelijck ul aenstaen hebt maer te commandeeren deken
wout gegint te genesen & heeft mij heden belooft in weijnigh daghe de Rek
te geven vant geene aen ul schuldigh is, soo sal aen houden & debvoor doen voor
ul. als voor eijgen terwijlen blijve
In Antwerpen 10 june
P. P
Bruss
konnecroy
&. den ul van 6 deser ontfang gesien wat ul van toillete schrijft
ul. kan dat met gaete koopen van 4:6 a 8 a lanck & bedinght het soor
naw alst mogelijck is doch soo het geene fradj. patroone is soude selve
niet begeeren boven dien kan ul met occasie een a 2 ander op setten te
weten een trailie, & I met gatten van ontrent ƒ14 a 18: a opdat
moght gereet wesen binnen 3 weken, segge voor Lick mits als wan
schicke bij ul te sijn & p avonture noch wat meer sal koopen
soo ul fraij goet gereet heeft, waer mede ne groet byd
In Antwerpen 10 gamil
Brugge Raphael Coots
Mons d ul aengenamen van 8 deser verstaen dat de 2 packen tijken
N.8„9 P onlander van Adriaen block op london stonde te vertrek
godt sende de selve salvo, gesien dat een cluock met den winter sijn
huys bewaert, en sijn schip tot grave fande lagh ick ben vegoon
dat daer de hievere noch nanigable is, eghter wensche hij gearrive
was mijn Rek van onkoste als mede e corant sient gemoet, om
soo het voorleden jaer totsluten ul trato wert promt vol
daen de certificatie voor 3 packen lijn waert, gaet hier benefere
recommande ul deselve wel mogen versorght worden, als mede
de packen met pindaer gearriveert op maeldagh weert ul toe
gesonden een paxken AV.N7 met canten om t' selve n aeondr
te senden aen meester Abram vivians pr eenigh golde ofte secure
occasie soo deselve soo voorvalt ander sal daer van 6 nieuwe
poort disponeere, terwijlen dat met den selve bede voor af
gaet divectelijck Noch een N6: waer mede nae groetenise
In Antwerpen 11 Janu 1681
Dublin Elnathan Lumme
th th
Sr. sence I have wrott to you on the 5: & 16 gber last non from you in answer
of them, thought I have in due time recd. 2 from you of 30 8 & 2 gb past
as I have advised you and according to the accts. sent you, is the chocolatie
att Amsterdam with mr. De Hulter & van Homright, the sending forward
of the same I doubt is hindred because of the continuall frost wee had ever
sence: intrim I have a makeing a parcell of guild leather & bought
2 parcell of tapstey by order mr. De Hulter & van Homright, which I
supose is for you they will be ready by that the riviers shall be
navigable. when I have yd. order for the pistolles & fuses itt shall be
accomplished with all possible care in case you intended to have some
laces & that you had the conveniency of bringing in, itt is now
the best time to buy that com. I haveing brought a month
sence a good round parcell for freindes of London & to my minde
50 St. cheaper then any other time of the yeare where in
I can further serve you freely command wishing you an happynesw
yeare accompanied with as many felicities as you desire Remand
In Antwerp 11 janua. 1681
Topsam Thomas Ledyingham
S sence you wrott to mee on the 1/3 gd last have recd. the 2 bales of
white perpetuanios you sent to mr. Anneslay truely I had expected
them much better, for I found the 12 p. 1 ½ ijds white infervor
to the frift you sent mee, and the ells whites hardely vendable
for such sorts I must asseure you I have been better furnished
from tineston: whoever wee shall want a new suply towards bring
where fore pray lett mee have yd advise here into, how that com
sells att present hopeing to understand that they be fallen & more plont
In Antwerp 11 Janu 81
London Abram Vivians
S. I wrott to you the 7: curitt what then was needfull now, you have herd
A
inclosed an accompt of what I bought for you till : xb last which
is made up in 3 packetts assorted as itt is noted in the same accts att
one side N. 6 will come pr the packett boatt itt cont the finest sorts
which I doubt not butt will prove to content the packetts N. 7& 8
shall be keept by mr. Raphael Coots till you have recd. N. 6, or that
any secure opportunitie happers to by shipt for London directly, so
you have butt to send yd. orders I bought yeasterday one broad lace of 3 of an
ell: trailles butt a curous great shew & there is 2 others a mackeing one
without .. an an other trailles, which as soone as don shall be
sent by the packett boatt in N.9: I have yett for about £60: flemish
lace brought this month besides the broad laces & incon that 2
months hence they shall not be hadd for that price by 10 a 12 Pa 8
